why_choose_section.title: Why Choose Synchrony for Gastrointestinal Devices
why_choose_section.description: Four decades of surgical device expertise provides specialized infrastructure, validated disease models, and proven regulatory success that general preclinical facilities cannot match.

cards.title: Specialized Surgical Infrastructure
cards.description: Purpose-built surgical suites accommodate complete robotic systems with advanced imaging integration, insufflation monitoring, and real-time performance documentation. Our facilities support complex gastrointestinal procedures while maintaining environmental controls and sterile conditions throughout validation studies.

cards.title: Obesity Disease Model Expertise
cards.description: Validated obesity-induced models enable realistic assessment of bariatric device performance in metabolic disease conditions. Our team understands weight management mechanisms, surgical intervention outcomes, and long-term device effectiveness assessment that bariatric technology development requires.

cards.title: Surgical Device Regulatory Success
cards.description: Successful FDA submissions across robotic platforms, bariatric devices, and tissue sealants demonstrate our ability to generate data that addresses reviewer expectations for surgical intervention technologies requiring comprehensive safety and performance validation.

services.title: Bariatric Device Validation
services.description: Weight loss devices face unique challenges proving therapeutic effectiveness while ensuring long-term safety in obesity conditions. We evaluate bariatric intervention performance using validated obesity-induced disease models that replicate metabolic dysfunction and altered anatomy characteristic of severe obesity. Our protocols assess device durability under sustained mechanical stress, tissue response at implant interfaces, and weight management effectiveness through standardized metabolic monitoring. From adjustable gastric band pressure regulation to endoscopic sleeve device positioning accuracy, our testing addresses both 510(k) pathways demonstrating substantial equivalence and PMA requirements for breakthrough obesity treatment technologies requiring comprehensive effectiveness demonstration.

services.title: Robotic Surgical Platform Assessment
services.description: Robotic surgery systems require validation proving teleoperation accuracy translates to precise tissue manipulation during minimally invasive gastrointestinal procedures. We test articulating instrument performance through complex motion sequences while measuring force feedback accuracy and tremor filtration effectiveness. Advanced imaging systems document visualization quality throughout procedures while specialized protocols assess instrument jaw closure forces, articulation precision across multiple degrees of freedom, and durability under repeated actuations exceeding clinical use patterns. Our surgical suites accommodate complete robotic platforms including patient carts, vision systems, and surgeon consoles configured to match operating room setups, enabling comprehensive validation per ASTM surgical device standards supporting regulatory pathways for electromechanical surgical systems.

services.title: Tissue Sealant Characterization
services.description: Surgical sealants preventing anastomotic leaks must demonstrate adhesion strength sufficient to withstand intestinal pressure while supporting tissue healing without inflammatory complications. We evaluate sealant performance using burst pressure protocols that measure seal integrity under physiological stress conditions while tissue response studies assess healing quality and biocompatibility at application sites. Standardized leak detection methods quantify sealing effectiveness immediately following application and throughout healing phases addressing both acute and chronic performance requirements. Our GLP-compliant protocols support regulatory submissions across fibrin-based, synthetic polymer, and biological sealant platforms requiring ISO 10993 biocompatibility demonstration alongside mechanical performance validation for gastrointestinal surgical applications.
